3vEI0TPPaUeI5UCwi2tFVg.text: Without hyperbole, the best Indian food I have ever had. My wife and I are both big fans of Indian cuisine, and we both agreed that this was our best meal in the UK and the best Indian food we have had anywhere. Ordered the chicken tikka masala and tandoori chicken w/ rice naan and raita. 10/10.

mOxySNw-bwG6pTwYPoh7mw.text: Great butter chicken and naan.  Prawn masala was good too.  Wait staff tend to hover

XcjgjmXrBLK26imyKUeoMA.text: We have mostly good thing to say abut this restaurant.  We had a variety of dishes and they were all good.  The Bhindi and the lamb dish (can't recall which one) were the highlights.  The shrimp dish was the weakest.  The restaurant itself is pretty nice.  The upstairs is a bit nicer than the downstairs (basement) area.  The service was very friendly, but there was a long delay while other people's orders were coming out.  I suspect that they misplaced our order.  They comped us a side dish for the delay, but this slip-up still knocks them down to 3 stars in my book.

XEtnvPMeWSMJvda6aTqVWQ.text: Our last dinner in London was recommended by the hotel concierge.  It was a good recommendation, the service was exceptional and the food was really tasty!  We both had spicy chicken dishes, their special rice and garlic naan.  I also had a mango lassie, yummy!  A short walk from Paddington station.

0wH87tZM78zOx-QKA9jHzg.text: Truly excellent food but small portions for the price, otherwise would have earned 5 stars from me. I'll be back.

YXVCt-IwhtRoRCEBriCmQQ.text: Really good indian food, the staff was very service minded and quick. Low prices But delicious food! You should try it!

qGJ0NP7VdpKB1j7GbYj5qw.text: Reasonable price, reasonable food, good service, conveniently located near paddington and excellent pub across the street.  Have eaten my fair share of Indian, middle of the pack.

bOGk2K6fsBS1nD9vFlFBog.text: Yet again, this place surprises!  The food here is fantastic, and though it is a little light on providing the snazzy ambiance we may all be accustomed to look forward to for a London restaurant, it makes all of that up with the quality of the food.  Some of the best Indian I have ever had and definitely worth the wait if you happen to get there a little late.  I would recommend getting there before 8pm if you want to avoid the crowds, but this place is one of the really great restaurants that I will frequent every time I can get to London!Most definitely their naan is some of the best I have had.  The vinadloo's?  Well, let's put it this way, if you don't have a tolerance for heat, order the lighter fare.  But, if you want to really taste what a 'real' vindaloo level of heat tastes like, there is absolutely no disappointment here!Definitely worth the time to find and enjoy a great meal!

hM-P4brysTV5KhauB7gwXA.text: OK, here's the bad news; this is NOT the best Indian in London; the food is, however, very good.Vindaloo had just the right amount of heat, Tarka Dhall had that slightly burnt taste that it should. Portion size was (for me) just right.The biggest downside was due to the Norrjahan's success. 8-9pm on a midweek night, it was very full of very shouty (white) blokes. The pair of waiters were a bit run off their feet, the service was a tad tardy and the acoustics of the place meant that the shouty men drowned everyone else out. Bill was £24 for dinner and a beer.I'll be back; I'm sure the menu has lots to offer, but I'll plan to get in a bit earlier before the Humphreys arrive :-/

6wajgT36vVz33m_1BaOUKQ.text: I didn't think the food was all that great (I am Indian so I should know).  I booked a table here because it was close to my hotel and the reviews posted were just raving about this place.  One of the dishes I ordered had more sugar in it than spice in the creamy sauce and it tasted just blah!  I don't think I would ever come back to this place again....

dk3U2HtjyJNQBA3Z4ysTQg.text: Yelped in here w 2 kids , looking for great Indian food in London,  perfect choice.  The wait staff were perfectly attentive,  felt like we had 3 friendly faces hovering over us the whole time.  The chili lamb was incredible, very fresh flavors and spices, and butter chicken was spot on.  The servers did a great job in bringing our things that our 7 and 5 y.o.s enjoyed also.  The pamapadoms came out with very fresh tasting condiments that I haven't tasted before.  Would recommend.

H-INUtBrBE78TEG-Oz__3A.text: Overall I was somewhat disappointed. I had the king prawn puri and the spicy chicken tikka masala. Both were ok but I've had more flavorful versions elsewhere. I need to keep looking for a good "standard british" indian restaurant in London.

Q8StwmX9ajfoxxkW4lQLAA.text: Excellent food. Really wonderful flavors. Easy place to eat as a solo diner. Staff helpful and attending. Would recommend to all.

Zbw3B26oBN0Ak88oWb5v8Q.text: Everything we had we were really happy with. My wife got the set menu and loved it. The goat was great! I got one of the chef specials and it had great flavor and didn't feel too heavy. Everything was reasonably priced.

x07lxkVM3a8MoZO69jB8dg.text: It was really really good. Chicken Tikka Massalah not very spicy, portions could be slightly bigger but amazing tastes...

I98bb7npYs0zY9QzmI1G6A.text: Before coming to London in 2006, I didn't eat Indian food. I was never properly introduced to it. That trip changed everything. Since then, I have been a big fan of quality Indian food. Literally the day after I moved here I was craving Indian. Fortunately, while out with a client, he suggested Indian food and one of the other agency guys knew of this place. We walked in, were seated immediately, and had wonderful service. We all order wine and a bunch of food. There was about 7 dishes for the four of us and it was just the right amount of food. Not sure what dish was my favorite. The goa was great, the lamb was done so well. I think the only not liked dish was the duck. Not much kick to it and not nearly as good as everything else. This will remain one of my go back to places! Absolutely amazing food and service here.

cVjcxOZZUrR3kEBQhqsgKg.text: Food was blah, Not much flavor, and def nothing distinctive, Service was very good. Nice ambiance. Overall disappointing.

Njg-LtZ7KbW_TuNYOa-JWA.text: Best Indian food I've had in London. And Indian food is VERY good in London. This is "Noor Jahan 2", not to be confused with "the other one."£65 never tasted so good. I sat down, ALONE, mind you. The help was prompt, the environment was not overly crowded. They tried to help me with explaining: THE HAND FLIPPED UP - "I don't need instructions to know how to rock" When I cracked the menu open, I knew what to get, I've seen it all before countless times..I ordered, all at once: 6 beers (Cobra), Papadum, Paapdi Chaat, Panni poori, Onion Bhajhi, Chicken Tikka Masala (Hot & Spicy), Chicken Vindaloo (Hot as hell), Garlic Naan, Kulfi, Masala chai.I watched as others in the restaurant were licking napkins as if the food was too hot. But to me this stuff 'burned smoothly.' The stuff is really really terrific. But if you order the dishes on the spicy side, they come that way.I saw a few folks ordering wine, I was amazed, the flavors here utterly destroy wine, grab a Cobra, because you'll need a lot of washing down fluid.Everything exceeded my expectations except possibly the Onion Bhaji. I would come here over and over again, and the best part of it is, is right across the street is a wicked Fuller's Pub - the Victoria. I went and drank more tapped pints than I remember at this point.Rarely does food reach highs like this. Maybe I went on a "good day" and was lucky, but I don't think so. I think this place is a home run. Go there.

MHbBC3isPd1m9OaBOcdasg.text: It was great!  Tandoori Mixed Grill was prepared nicely and Tandoori Naan was delicious.

MgvjKpRPC7C8S6QN4QoTSQ.text: As good as it gets!  Amazingly complex flavors, expertly prepared.  Especially loved the Hariali Chicken Tikka appetizer (boneless chicken marinated in yogurt, flavored with mint, coriander and green chilis, charcoal grilled to perfection) and Lamb Vindaloo (such a complex and flavorful sauce with big chunks of the most tender and tasty lamb.

BYsFm0e72jDMHImkplQO-g.text: Great location and service. The lamb vindaloo was exquisite.

37Y4Mdj7dI-Yzh_QlTGlzg.text: The food and service were excellent. They accommodated my allergies and I had a delicious meal with a St Emilion Grand Cru. I haven't had better Indian food in Los Angeles or London.

FozHwExLiqXAP-AfrQAG2g.text: Solid food and service in a good setting.  This is a staple for me when I am in town.  My go to dish is the vindaloo, excellent taste and hot, but not too hot.

ioqfyT2oQ6nl_b8mVvgQbg.text: Monday evening and the place was full, which is always a good sign. I had the set menu for one person, thinking that the portions would be sized for one person and provide a nice assortment. It turned out to be large enough that I could have split it with my wife and gone away content. The food itself was quite good  I particularly liked the Hariali Chicken Tikka appetizer.

MZIkwXpJicPeG7C7JvUD0g.text: Loved it! Had chicken tiki masala with rice and naan. It was flavorful and just the right amount of spice. Recommended it if your in the Paddington area.

bPnyUqzew-f_jX4sdXufqQ.text: Our first dinner in London was divine thanks to the yelp reviews of this place. Everything, including the service, was phenomenal. The hubby ordered the achari chicken, which I unabashedly helped myself to. I ordered the Noorjahan special chicken, which was also devoured. We will stay in Hyde park in the future visits to the UK just to be closer to this place!

tbehKqB5IJgLh28cX-g6qg.text: We had less than 24 hours in London.  We were staying at the LHR airport.  We needed Indian Food.  Noorjahan II was just the answer.After taking the train to Paddington Station we walked to Noorjahan II.  We were very disappointed to find out that it did not open until 6:00 p.m.  Not to be deterred, we went to the Victoria Pub next door.  (see review elsewhere)When Noorjahan II did open, we were glad we waited.  We had the Lamb Vindaloo and the Achari Chicken.  Wow!  The Lamb Vindaloo was super hot.  In a good way.  My mouth was burning and I was so happy that the tears from the heat could have been tears of joy.  My wife had the Achari Chicken and it was equally fantastic.  We sopped up every morsel of flavor with excellent garlic Naan.  Our plates were exceedingly clean.The place is small so reservations may be helpful.  Our service was excellent.Thank you!  We hope to be back soon.

XD-eokSP3R9cyMc2S9ox3A.text: Great food and very courteous staff. I will definitely come back on future visits to the Paddington area.

SEpzT7WGfwtfZLZ1i3wBog.text: Ugh.   I lived in India for a while and grew to love (and learn how to cook) the food, so while I'm not an expert, I feel like I know authentic.  I am from Los Angeles, and thus definitely spoiled as far as having authentic Indian cuisine.  But I thought that London was supposed to have good Indian food... or at least those were the rumors??  So we were excited to try this out.This was *not* authentic Indian food, and besides being inauthentic, it was just kind of gross, to be honest.  My paneer was chewy and tasteless, in a watery gravy that when made right should be creamy and thick.  My husband's dinner was similarly tasteless.  The Naan was tiny and uninspired.  Not to mention the waiter put the food onto our plates for us - so much for family style!Finally, the staff were pretty rude, and it was incredibly expensive.  Again, maybe I'm spoiled but in LA we would pay 1/3 of that for much higher quality.

xzEpCxCEYSTqj-ZSzZWNxg.text: Visiting London on business this restaurant was a 10 min. walk from our hotel. It is one of the best Indian restaurants I've ever been to. From the Papadams to the Duck, everything was beautifully done, and flavorful. The service and atmosphere are very high end, they have also have outdoor seating, and it is very reasonably priced, for London. Highly recommend.

oymXH73HHSR70hSCIZrm5A.text: This was one of our many Indian experiences in London and I would say it was one of our best.  Very good food.  We had many of the favorite dishes.  My only advice would be to avoid the BBQ Duck, it was tasty but very small portion for the price.Get the appetizer sampler and make sure you have some Lamb dishes as they were all AMAZING!Definitely going back when I am in London again.

RNu2OCJiFbSFGRTc2QxGsA.text: Decent food. I started with a cold chaat appetizer (which was a little odd, most chaat I've had in the past are served warm/hot), followed by a lovely duck curry. The waiter was a little too pushy for my taste in terms of ordering sundries like rice, naan, sauce, dessert. However, the flavors were outstanding. Price-wise, the meal was quite fair (35 GBP) including a tasty mango lassi, tax and tip. Would I go out of my way to eat there again? No, but if you're in the neighbourhood and are feeling a bit peckish for Indian, it's a good bet.

tfsBOF25o4hf7rNfQOb8TA.text: I come here every time I visit London.  Everything is great.  My favorites are the vegetable samosas (thinner and crispier crust than most places, filling is extraordinary) and the chicken tikka masala.  But I have had so many things (last night I had the house lamb curry dish, the saag paneer is amazing, the shrimp pancake appetizer is great, all the naans ...).  They only have Cobra beer in the large bottles, which is fine with me.5 stars.  No brainer.

8nQx3A5e3iASs8CbyMvM2Q.text: After reading the reviews I was looking forward to this place, but maybe my expectations were different.  In any case I was confused how different the place seemed from the reviews.Two things immediately different: this place has a fleet of servers, complete with a maitre d', and the prices reflect it; my meal for one ended up being about 25 pounds, so there's no way I would rate this place as two pound signs in price.The service was attentive--too attentive, hovering.  I just wanted to relax and this is the kind of place that puts the napkin on your lap for you (that literally happened).  I guess that's what some people call service, but the waiters were so unsmiling and dispassionate that it was quite awkward.  They were there standing over my table for every moment of the meal, until I wanted the bill, at which point they seemed to not want to acknowledge I was ready to leave.  They seemed offended I was not interested in dessert.  I wish I had known I was walking into such a formal place before I had gone, other reviews don't make much mention of it.The main dish was good but not great, and the naan was passable.  I'd say 3-3.5 stars on the food, but the price was high and the service was cold.  There's much better Indian for cheaper in London, and there's certainly much better Indian at that price!  Would not go back.

mS2CLex7osCWCKNOcaI7Qg.text: Had an excellent meal. I gave it five stars due to the great dishes and reasonable prices. I had the Chicken Tikka Masala for my main, with naan and rice. I had an appetizer sampler including a lamb chop, which was awesome.

4qJvn_GV0U955Xe8Mm3Y0w.text: So amazing, my brother and I went to dinner there two days in a row during our vacation. The chicken tikka masala is to die for. As are the potatoes and nan bread.

FcqgwALpgpj1vg8bIS4i_w.text: Came in for lunch and had the Samosa appetizer, Lamb Roganjosh, Chicken Jalfrezzi, Palau rice, curried mixed vegetables, and garlic naan.   All were delicious and had just the right amount of spice.   Best indian food I've had.  Even better than the most highly ranked indian restaurant in Washington DC, USA.  The servers weren't that friendly, but they were at attentive.

3rGP3-dpviKgy004wth1gw.text: Nice  restaurant , within walking distance of Paddington and Queensway... Also not too far from bayswater... Delish food and staff that's always been friendly and helpful! We normally hit here after a session at The Victoria across the street....

QaaqOenN6QbonlQIZGzROw.text: Well, I don't call myself a pro when it comes to Indian food, but I have had my fare share of bad, OK, and great Indian food. After reading all the reviews I was very excited to head on over and try this place out. It was a perfect night out and was able to snag a table outside. The smell of the food from the kitchen was getting my hopes up. Unfortunately, the service was extremely slow. I finally got to place my order and asked for the chicken tikka masala, an order of naan and a coke. It took so long for my food to come out, I began to wonder if the chef was in the back running after the chicken trying to catch it for my meal. When my food finally came out, it looked delicious. As I took the 1st couple of bites I was little disappointed in the lack of flavor that existed in this dish. It was a little too on the bland side for me. Once I finished eating and they had cleared my plate I had another long wait after asking 2 of the waiters for my bill. In my opinion, this place is mediocre at best.

WJFT75-LYc6gnIvwphEftg.text: I had two days in London recently, so I knew I had to prioritize my meals. I can't stop in London without seeking out some Indian food.Noorhajan is convenient to Paddington, and while a bit on the upscale side (white tablecloths and such), it is excellent and just enough off the main thoroughfares to avoid the tourist crowds. Well, except this tourist. But I was with a local, so I don't count, right?They have a great selection of curry dishes, and were very good about adjusting the level of spiciness to suit. When the weather is decent, there's a nice outdoor seating area right in front of the restaurant. It's quiet except for the occasional truck (I mean, "lorry") or motorcycle going by.They could improve the beer and wine selection - especially the wine. There are some standard wines on the list, but little I'd pair with curry. One of these days, more Indian restaurants will figure that out.I did think it was on the expensive side for Indian food - dinner for two with one large beer, bread, rice and a starter was about 65 pounds. Maybe I'm just spoiled by cheap hole-in-the-wall places in California, where the same is often 50 to 75% less. Or the US is just a third-world country now.

YDXHHPCEeqYjxo8MK8TXMg.text: We had a funny and tasty dinner here. Service was good and we got some dishes on the house. Would recommend the vegetable samosa (very crispy) and the rogan josh, but the best was the seasoned chicken tikka which comes sizzling to your table. We had three mains a bowl of rice and a garlic naan for the main course which was more then enough. And of course, Cobra beer:-).

cjqzIb7nhrtonTzP1HQCnA.text: Very good, tasty and plentiful Indian food. We ate the Chicken Tikka Masala, Okra, and Garlic Naan. Compared with other restaurants in London, this is a very good place. Relatively quiet and nice place to eat - definitely recommend

uK0El3thzD8NDEIkWHV-AA.text: Traveling solo in London for a week.  I was getting tired of the sandwiches and sushi go rounds that make dining alone easier.  The restaurant filled up after I got there, with what seemed like people that lived in the neighborhood.  There were several other solo diners there, from their conversations with the staff, they dined there frequently.I had the garlic naan, one of the lamb dishes, and a simple rice.  It was all so very delicious.  I probably ate more that I should, it was just so good.I was very impressed with the service, someone was always checking on me, making sure my water glass was filled, and if I needed anything.  I found the prices to be quite reasonable as well.  I really enjoyed the food here, and would return if I am in the same neighborhood again.

NXMW1r383F18sOqnar9U_w.text: The ambiance was nice and quiet.  More of an upscale Indian restaurant.  Bottle water was 3.5 pounds so you might as well spring for the GIANT Cobra beer.  The garlic naan was perfect!  Went great with the Saag Gosth (A combination of lamb cooked with fresh spinach, coriander and other fragrant herbs) and Chicken Tikka Masala.  The vegetable Samosa was definitely good, but definitely over-priced...Definitely a nice dinner but over-priced for Indian food.

77yAA3OV_gRD_79iJITj-w.text: We had the Chicken Tikka Massala, and it was fantastic. As was the Nan bread and rice. Really fantastic food.

z3Vdbl0Y4yoCQX1m8YVJ1Q.text: I picked this place based on a yelp review and must say I was disappointed :-( The curries were mild, lacked in flavour and not cheap. In the land of curry there are many places that offer better value for money than this place does.I don't think I will come back here again. Mediocre curry for a high price is too hard to swallow for me :-)

ufVkgiFaMOsP0plEVOykIw.text: My mom and I tried this restaurant on our trip to London and absolutely loved it. We came across it en route to our hotel and it was our favorite and most memorable restaurant that we visited during the entire trip.We ordered vegetable samosas, chicken tikka, garlic naan, basmati rice, and chicken tikka masala. The vegetable samosa dish (comes with two samosas) came very quickly and tasted great - very mild but the light spice was enough. After eating our entrees, my mom said that the chicken tikka was delicious. I ordered the chicken tikka masala and ate every last bite. The sauce was definitely flavorful (on the tikka masala) and had some spice to it, but people who are afraid to order it because they don't like their food too spicy should not worry - it was not overbearingly spicy by any means. The garlic naan was equally tasty and it was a perfect addition to my tikka masala. After I had finished eating the chicken, I ate the remaining naan with any leftover sauce from the chicken. Delicious.If I come back to London someday, I will definitely want to return to the restaurant! Service was great and the restaurant seemed to always be busy when my mom and I passed. Good, authentic Indian food - hopefully, we'll be back! Highly recommend.

Ind_xFIpAa7lq-kGl0IVMQ.text: We had an excellent lunch at NoorJanan this past week.  My friend ordered the Spicy Chicken Tikka Masala, while I had the non-spicy version.  We also shared some plain and garlic naan, as well as the Saffron Pilau Rice.  It was absolutely delicious.Thanks to the other yelp reviews for leading us to a great lunch!

CTk3QMBENSDCfcNWKZ9iKQ.text: I actually want to go back to London specifically to eat here again. I kind of just wandered in, desperate for some Indian food on my last night there. I ordered the chicken jalfrezi, which was a great choice as I was told the chef has a recipe that is different than the norm (I think they said only one of the chefs there has it, but not sure). Anyway - it was the best Indian food I've ever had. I'm fairly desperate to have it again. If you can, go.

KJUVntnKxB8pJXtQLS3GVA.text: What to do when in London for 36 hours??Indian food is on top of the list. Hands down.I was staying within walking distance of this restaurant. Thanks to Yelp, I was able to find a great place for dinner and make a quick reservation over the phone.I had a Cobra beer, Chicken Tika Masala and Naan/Rice.OMFG. SOOOOOOOOO Good!!!If I were to compare California Indian with UK Indian, I would say it's like eating at your Aunties house. Of course your Mom's cooking will always be #1, but your aunts is a close 2nd. ALMOST tied!I loved the flavor of the curry. CA has very red tomato based curry and here it was more on the yellow side and had wonderful aromas and flavors I could not distinguish. The papadom was also very different and did not have a poppy seed cracker consistency like ours. Very puffy/light instead. The chutneys were AMAZING. Better than our jam like chutneys here in CA. Wish I had a travel buddy with me in London so I could share other dishes. Can't wait to come back in December!!

M7fVXbnmj1PKQbIqJbuv5w.text: Hubby did some stellar research before our trip to England to find this restaurant where I had the best Indian food I've ever tried. I loved how it's location allowed us to take the tube to Paddington station where I got to pose with Paddington Bear himself, haha.  I could go into detail about each dish, but seriously, EVERYTHING was a hit, there were NO misses. Order whatever tickles your fancy and you probably can't go wrong!

YkYXjB_fagQ-lGc-wWoHDg.text: We had a great meal at this restaurant. The servers were so attentive. After ordering the food, I don't think I needed the garlic naan. So much food for me but I'm glad.

bDUn-c4m9ZVLv38ca9bmIw.text: Tried this Indian restaurant on our trip to London, wanting some decent but not overly expensive Indian.  it is a nice local restaurant in a quiet neighbourhood, a short walk from Lancaster Gate tube.Four of us had a selection of dishes, of which the Jafreezey Chicken was my favourite, although everyone loved everything we had.  Overall staff were fairly attentive, and the dinner was very enjoyable, and affordable at about £20 each plus service.  Highly recommended

K5-wsLR79bTskeH5tawTgA.text: A short walk from Paddington train station, Noorjahan fulfilled my desire for delicious Indian food in London.  The restaurant is in a quiet neighborhood sufficiently removed from the busy tourist traffic of the train station, with a nice outdoor eating area.  I arrived at 9:30 pm for a late dinner--the kitchen is open until 11 or 11:30 pm--and found plenty of seating.  Service was efficient though not particularly friendly, maybe because I was a solo diner.I started with a vegetable samosa, followed by lamb rogan josh, with garlic naan on the side.  All washed down with Cobra beer.  I savored every bite of every dish--the samosa had a light, crispy shell and was filled with large chunks of vegetables.  The rogan josh was served on a bed of rice and was succulent and flavorful, not too spicy.  And the naan was light, fluffy and just a bit chewy.I don't know enough about Indian food to know whether it was authentic, but I've had enough to know when it's good versus merely so-so.  And this was really good.

GwurfDWRo1dtn2eD7ojOBg.text: Okay, I'm going to set some context here - my wife is Goan, and both my mother in law and father in law are PHENOMENAL cooks. I've eaten some of the best south and mid-Indian food out there. At least, I THOUGHT I had. We (group of friends and coworkers) came here on a lark when we couldn't get a table at the Victoria next door. Best thing that ever could have happened. The staff were friendly and accommodating, and out up with our hijinks with humour and playfulness. The apps were hot, sizzling so even, and a beautiful start tit he meal. The food, oh God the food. It was HEAVEN. THE CURRIES!!  Particularly the Goan chicken and fish curries!  The vindaloo was Devine and SCREAMING hot. Soooooo tasty. Biryani was sublime, the naan fluffy and dense at the same time, and the paratha were flaky and tasty. There wasn't a hint, a modicum, a whisper of oil. How's that for a quality measure. Come here. Often. Regularly. At every opportunity!

swPiklhuXaMLnw5Rh2y7Ew.text: I give them 4+ on food, but 2 on service. They left off parts of my order and didn't get parts of it correct (plain instead of garlic naan). At times I felt a bit forgotten, they seemed a bit more attentive to English patrons. However, the food was great. The spicy chicken tika masala was not hot as I expected (at all really), but had a greater depth of flavor and slight overtones of cinnamon - absolutely loved it! I also had one of the mixed sampler appetizer plates and that was also great. I do recommend it, just know you may see mixed levels of service.

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Mix / samples appetizers
Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Spicy chicken tika masala

9qYim11bvSrEVpVXZsHf0g.text: This place was really great. We went on a Monday night with 4 adults and 6 children aged 4-9 years old. We were treated like royalty. The food was excellent. The ambience was quiet (so we could all connect with the kids) and cozy.

mkbgWWHI6UosJyoDgkrBjQ.text: I had such high hopes for his restaurant based on reviews. We got there at 5:59 for dinner and the door was open. We were immediately accosted by the waiter about how we were too early. We apologized and told him that we'd gladly wait. He grunted, sat us down and told us "everyone has their own time these days."  We felt very uncomfortable.At 6:01 a group came in asking for a table and he was just as rude as him. When spending that much on dinner, I don't deserve to be treated like crap. We promptly left.

4owlVFrRTEp3iuu0g1KVMg.text: Had the Butter chicken and naan. It's good and tasty overall and on par with other places around. The decor and atmosphere of this place is overall good with decent service. They want to be a high end Indian place and the price reflects that.

15eJzDSDI4YTVEviSrW0JA.text: Food was very good.  The waiter was snotty - - maybe because a member of our party ordered tap  water??

8Xjoo2GyFoeUbS54s8r5NQ.text: Craving Indian Food in London so we stopped by the NoorJahan.  The service was outstanding.  I had the lamb jalfrazi. The meat was tender and had just the right amount of spice.  If you like cauliflower I recommend ordering the side dish to share.

qawTjCbcYsOwhPjoC1v2qQ.text: Food: definitely a ten! So flavorful and amazing. I would definitely get take away from here next time. They lost a star because their service was  slow, curt, and unfriendly. I mean, when you start asking your spouse, "Did they forget about us? Is this because we're Americans?" Also, £3.50 for bottled water? I think that's crazy, but maybe it's that expensive everywhere...? Next time, we'll just get take away to avoid the service and the expensive bottled water.

7xfzIhnBELbu4F0zKyHHZQ.text: I came here with some co-workers and tried the lamb pual. Beware it is super spicy not like what you would get in the states. Sadly it was also very bitter. Overall the meal wasn't too enjoyable, but next time I should try something else.

p_HV4lM4YqNMryIX7g9tHw.text: The food was pretty oily. The starters (sag tikki, samosa) were full of oil. The paneer makhani was sweet despite asking for no sugar and a spicy curry. Do not try brinjal curry if you happen to visit the place (its oily and tasteless).The only good thing was dal tarka.The staff was not courteous and was focused only on couple of tables (probably their frequent customers). Overall, not so great a experience.

0mseYZt41zIXdNHSgUAg2Q.text: Ordered the spicy chicken tikka masala, a korma dish, garlic naan and cobra beer. Came in with high hopes, but both dishes were pretty bad. The dishes were sickeningly sweet. Service was pretty bad despite their attempt to be "high class" (napkin over your lap, serving food into your plate, and taking forever to get their attention). If you're craving Indian food around the area check other places as this place is not only over priced, but not authentic.

hmtJJ1wSOF-wgKHFKAIc2A.text: Wow. Best Chicken Tikka Masala and Vindaloo I've had. Ever.Here's before and after picture of our meal:instagram.com/p/BHxZM9zg…

Px1-YrTY0P-HlCquLRAQ9Q.text: There are so many good Indian restaurants in London, and while Noorjahan isn't the fanciest, it's definitely one of the tastiest.Service: Friendly and fast. Ambiance: Not a large place, and we were the only ones enjoying lunch the day before NYE. Super clean, even the bathrooms, which is a difficult thing to find in an Indian restaurant.Food: Everything was delicious.-- Samosas: My 9-year-old ate 2 of these and couldn't stop saying how much she liked them. I didn't get to try them (she doesn't share well).-- Spinach Kabob: Not sure exactly what this appetizer was called, it was mix between a pakora and a kabob, made of spinach and fried. SO unhealthy but SO good.-- Chicken Tikka - My husband said it was excellent (I don't eat chicken).-- Tarka Dal - Excellent.-- Dried Mixed Vegetable - Not greasy and quite tasty.-- Plain Rice - It was rice, what can I say?-- Naan / Tandoor Roti / Aloo Paratha - We went a bit crazy on the carbs but they were all quite good. Definitely recommend all of these.Bottom Line: We'll definitely return if we're in the area. Noorjahan was a hit!

R1yXU7RHLdmdDOp1w68afA.text: Phenomenal Indian food. Every dish is great. Can be a bit pricey but the food quality is amazing. The naan is perfect and the meat is juicy, tender, and incredibly flavorful.

pucmECQSsE47twV1gI8K5Q.text: Perhaps the best Indian meal ever. Had the combo for starters and the spicy chicken Tikka Masala for main. Both were excellent! Service is good. Atmosphere is quiet and authentic.

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Spicy chicken tikka masala
Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Starters combo

KtP04n12wijvUHy62s6Ucw.text: Um, just go here. Please. There is no possible way if you like Indian food you could be disappointed. My colleague suggested this for dinner, as she had been here on a past visit. I made her go back two nights later. My favorite thing at Indian restaurants is bhindi. This place does it better than any other I've ever been to. They do it as a side dish, so I had it with delicious samosas and an awesome mango lassi. I was full. The second time we went, my colleague suggested we split a shrimp appetizer. I can't remember what it's called. Just get it. It was so awesome, but filling. After that appetizer, it was hard to finish the rest of my meal, but I tried my best. As silly as it sounds, I would have been happy to eat here every day. If you're visiting from a tube stop, get off at Paddington Station, go through the Hilton Paddington and out their front doors onto the street. Walk straight ahead of you for about four blocks. It's an easy walk from the station or the Hilton Paddington.

nGXhJOQdiGfINn6-CWsqEA.text: Good food but before you order they act like you are gonna steal the spoons or something.

NS5H7ic1UAQn0kSxf4xiwQ.text: Just a little over 4 blocks from Paddington Station (in the same SE direction as incoming trains, down London Street) is a little gem of an Indian restaurant. During my recent week in London I returned there several times and was able to sample a number of dishes. All were delightful. The little corner restaurant is cozy inside with a very competent wait staff. But it is the food that drew me back. Everything I sampled was delicious.Their nan, which has been mentioned in prior reviews, could be the best I have ever tasted. A lamb appetizer folded into a puri 'pancake' could have been a meal in itself. It was a winner. Among the entrée dishes, I especially liked the chicken tikka, the lamb curry and their signature chicken dish. The curries come in three grades of heat. I ordered the 'Madras' which was described as 'hot', but I detected little if any heat. Next time I would go with the 'vindaloo' which is the next step up and described as 'very hot'. Their butter chicken was quite flavorful but had a subtle sweetness that I had a mixed reaction to. At between £9-13 a dish, the food quality surpasses many of its more expensive London competitors.

oWJViYiHcY1WDMZ7yLYgJg.text: In brief: Superb food, very attentive, friendly staff, nice atmosphere! If you like Indian cuisine and can not decide where to go, stop looking, and visit this place! Don't let the pictures of the dishes disguise you - it pretty much looks like your average curry or tandoori you can get anywhere else, but the quality makes all the difference! The lamb chops, the chicken and the kebab of the mixed starter are juicy and delicious, the naan bread is of unmatched quality and the rice smells wonderful. The curries are just like they should be - full of flavor, and spicy. This was definitely not my last visit, as there a lot more things to discover on the menu, which are impossible to cover in just one go!A clear and very well deserved five stars rating.

1epPf1-hHHB7wB7PVfb-qQ.text: Great spot overall. Really good food. Adequate service. Pretty decent value. Friendly ambiance. Certainly a place I would recommend to my friends.

3CstdUzlufLhxBOtr1GLMA.text: Just delicious Indian Food. And friendly service (something scarce in England), you really can't ask for more. My boyfriend and I were staying next to Paddington and this place was literally 3 blocks away. Amazing marinated lambshops! Flavorful, cooked well, served warm, had foil cover tips so that you wouldn't get your fingers too messy. At first we didn't know what to order so we asked our server and he said to do the lambchops and Chicken Goa. Both very very good!If i'm ever back in London, I would be sure to stop by this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom
Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom

EMTutDJasKJNSK3Y_XpQwQ.text: Decent food, but the Tikka Masala let it down by being way too sweet! I am not talking a little sweet, this was very sweet. I have never had a tikka masala  with so much sugar. It was a shame as the other things weren't bad.

umg8m73hUBKNHeQAmuv-qw.text: Classy and delicious Indian food - servers are friendly and are constantly waiting on you.  Worth a visit.

nFhpdMb-vf7NDS5Fn9giFw.text: I love this place. Try to stop in whenever I'm in the UK. Fantastic set menu for one, which is a real treat for solo business travelers.

55r8kqacSuqxgWXRkytfNw.text: Got take away and ordered the non spicy chicken tikka masala with rice and garlic Nan. It was so good!! The chicken is juicy and soft and they are generous with portions! Will be 2 meals for me. The sauce was not spicy as I requested and had so much flavor. Highly recommend. The garlic nan was not as crispy but it's probably because it was take away. An upscale place when I walked in, but good for families , friends or solo diners.

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Take away , chicken tikka masala and garlic nan!

pTiIupLh9S0wj8nPMUf9Mg.text: Excellent food. Very tasty. Waiter was a bit pushy to order more food but I'm glad we didn't as we were stuffed. There were lots of waiters that were attentive and friendly.

jG0iI81HGBfJKxBLJduaqQ.text: NoorJahan is great neighborhood Indian restaurant.  It is located in Paddington and has sidewalk seating as well as indoor, air conditioned seating.  On the night we went, it was a little later and was much cooler than it had been so we sat outside.The host promptly greeted us and sat us at a table and gave us menus.  We had out backpacks with us and he kindly took them and placed them off to the side so they weren't at our feet.  Our server cam to greet us and brought water. We asked a couple questions about the menu.  I asked if they had lamb korma. It wasn't on the menu but he said they could still make it.  Score!!! He also told me about different rice options to go with the curry that I hadn't seen on the menu.We ended up ordering a lamb seekh kebab appetizer, garlic naan, lamb korma with coconut rice, panir makhani and plain rice.  Yes this was for two people and somehow we did eat almost all of it!The seekh kebab's were absolutely wonderful.  They were full of flavor and then came with this herb sauce that made it even better.  I could eat those once a week easily!  The garlic naan was very good.  It has a good amount of garlic and coriander which is my favorite part.  The bread was also nice a slightly fluffy.  The lamb korma was not like I get in the states.  It was a little sweet with no heat.  I actually liked it.  It was different but very good.  The lamb was very tender and the sauce had a wonderful flavor and consistency. The coconut rice was amazing! I could eat it on a regular basis, it honestly didn't even need the curry but it just added something even more special to the curry and I really enjoyed it!My sister seemed to like her panir makhani and rice.The meal was well priced, about on par with other Indian restaurants. The service was great and at the end we got this very yummy little piece of chocolate.Great service, great food, nice sidewalk restaurant. Seriously a great meal.  I would easily recommend and if I lived anywhere in the vicinity I would be there on a regular basis!

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Seekh kebab. A must!
Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Coconut rice. Seriously dang good!!
Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Lamb korma. Not on the menu but they still made it for me!!

sET12uCgftPV3RZntKt-Ag.text: Had such an awful experience. I came alone around 1pm. There was no one else in the entire restaurant. I end up waiting for about 5 minutes before he comes and gives me a menu. I end up asking to get 2 items on the menu, as it turns out there is an 18pound  minimum.  So I order another two side items to hit the minimum.  If I ordered any more I wouldn't be able to finish anything. The guy is already rude from the start and becomes even more so after I order the remaining food. Looking at me if I was cheap etc... Then two white British guys come in and sit down. This time he immediately  serves them and gives them papaddum for free without them asking. When I had already ordered it. They came in 10 minutes after I did and were served food and drinks 5 minutes before I was even given a glass of water. Which I had to ask for.  Service of this one guy was terrible and will never have me come back.Normally I would never write anything bad, but this experience  was just terrible overall. Even as I was asking for the bill eating he started clearing the food while I was eating from one of the dishes... I also couldn't finish any of the food dishes 1) because  there was too much I had t ok order to hit the minimum  and 2) it wasnt appetizing

Lf9o2O_ag4jhsCeJxCNcIw.text: Got food to go and went based on others reviews. ordered three main dishes and they did not come with rice so we had to order that. also got some Naan. the Naan was good. the main dishes were very generous if you got. vegetarian items but the one meat dish was not as generous. all three were ok but lacked seasoning and flavour. the place didn't ask how hot to make it but based on the markings of the lids,. they made then what they considered medium so I would have expected flavor. The servers were ok but the place seemed based on charging for each little thing. the flavors weren't that good. I wouldn't say don't go but also isn't a wow to me.

syggevuth2wQNCbaF2gs5g.text: There are a lot of good options for Indian food in London .. this place is my favorite. Been coming here for many years and the food is consistently excellent.

8cY9Z-bTmvgXr4yTduY5yA.text: £16.80 for 6 bites of chicken 1 rice and 1 garlic naan. Simply an extortion! I almost forgot, the naan and the chicken were both over cooked!

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom

tBlFPMc_McBhPgFknGNDPg.text: Hey we are full, no you can't wait, get lost. Seriously this is unbelievable!What's wrong with Indian restaurants nowadays in London? The moment they get a bit of clientele and a few positive points on Yelp/Google, they get greedy and start throwing out single patrons or what?Even the basic decency of apologize before turning a patron off is so hard to do ?

nP1aMYMg4QMUtyj9H7dj3g.text: I came here on a Friday evening as a solo traveler because there weren't many options in the neighborhood. I was more than pleasantly surprised. The set menu is an excellent option for those who have an appetite and contained more food than I could eat, and I'm an American. Living in NYC I've been to many a good Indian restaurant and even so, the quality of the food here impressed me. Service was excellent with the whole team taking care of you. I would return in a heartbeat.

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom
Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom

Ca-edB_SjhkL3Hwh2d6Jpg.text: I don't recall what the Duchess and I ate, just that everything was delicious, and the prices were reasonable, the service good, and the ambience cozy. A bit too cozy, perhaps, if you desire intimate conversation (with your dining partner, not the strangers at your elbow), but nevertheless we were glad to have dined here.A note for cilantro-averse North American diners: in Britain, the herb that we call "cilantro" they call "coriander," whereas we think of the coriander seed when we hear "coriander."

pSEXNPBsfKJxcbI1_CULAQ.text: My husband and I are visiting from the States, and have been about as impressed as we expected to be by most of what we've eaten here. But we knew we had to try Indian while in the city. This little gem is in our neighborhood. We went just after 6p when it opened for dinner. We had wanted to do take-away, but the line was constantly busy so we went over. The place filled up fast with a good mix of tourists and locals. The service is friendly but formal. It may seem a little slow to Americans, as we are used to being rushed out of restaurants. There are white linen tablecloths, nice dinnerware and flatware. The menu is not as large as most Indian places in the States, but it had everything I knew plus a new dish to me, Biriyani. It's vegetables or meat mixed with rice and spices, fried in ghee, and served with vegetable curry. Scrumptious! For dessert I had a luscious, tart lemon sorbet, served in its own frozen lemon rind. I'm so sorry I'll only be here one more night, but I'll be there promptly at 6p again tomorrow evening.

nTn-e8Ok1XSzLUIwrfzk9Q.text: Returning to London from several days in Germany, I wanted to get my Indian fix in. NoorJahan II offers up familiar dishes (sizzling tandoori plates, chicken tikka masala, a nice selection of chicken, lamb, and veggie curries) prepared with care.While vindaloo (and phal) were tempting, I went with something milder: rogan josh with a side of Peshawari naan and a bottle of Cobra (a smooth Indian lager).That rogan josh was among the best I'd ever had: the lamb was fork tender, bathed in a richly spiced tomato curry. The naan, topped with toasted sesame seeds and filled with nuts and raisins, sopped up lingering curry.The waitstaff can be persistent in trying to upsell you, but it's a great meal in the end

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Rogan josh, Peshawari naan, glass of Cobra lager

RZmWZNuRXFQiqOw9loDQZA.text: We love the Indian food in London. This restaurant is excellent. The food is very good. Service is good. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is its atmosphere, which could use a bit of freshening. We went across the street so the pub, and had a pint, and then crossed the street for dinner - nice

UTHwIsRORCPpmZSr7cf9yQ.text: The food was okay but service was horrible. We didn't want to get bottle water after knowing the price tag of $3.50 from the previous restaurant. They acted very unwillingly to serve us lemon water in the jug. They never refill the water but keep coming to pour the beer from the bottle for my husband as they probably hope he finishes ASAP and get another bottle. We ordered Butter Chicken and Chef Special Chicken, both are very small in proton. All the severs look grumpy and didn't seem to want to interact with you. So we just guessed what might be good from the menu without getting recommendations. It turns out both taste very similar, butter chicken being creamier and sweeter. Toward the end getting the bill, they have the guts to have the gratuity prompt screen option. Of course when it's presented in front of you, it's kinda awkward not to give anything. So we paid 10% very unwillingly just like how they are reactant to provide some decent service.

dpmXSTQP-fNsCtHqqLllXw.text: I was a solo diner here, and they were welcoming as well as efficient. The first night I tried the Butter Chicken, while mild, still flavorful and the entire meal was very filling.  The second visit, I had the Chicken Tikka Masala. Again mild yet flavorful. I appreciated the prompt service, their recognition that I was a repeat diner, and the consistent quality of the food. Do try the selection of chutneys, very well executed and enhancing

LsilP2nuotVUuH6LeEj7eA.text: Worst people. Worst staff. Worst food. They even use sweat as way to fry food. Never never go to this place. I want to give them -5

SyfZTQtG4TtBA5Naj7tnMw.text: Coming from the Bay Area, there is a high bar to meet for Indian food, and this restaurant surpassed all expectations! The vegetable samosas were delicate and light. I ordered the special king prawns and it was perfectly spiced. The heat from the spices just lingered in your mouth and did not over power the delicately balanced flavors. The garlic naan was perfection. I recommend ordering a side of raita with nearly any dish. Would recommend this place to anyone visiting London

SrzySEIpY3I4ZaRrzKfF_Q.text: My first meal in London. After getting off an 11 hour flight and taking the Heathrow Express to our hotel near Paddington station, we were looking for a quick bite nearby before going to sleep. My bf and I had originally intended to check out a pub that was across the street, but it was packed and we were too hungry and tired to wait around. The restaurant was probably more than half empty so a lot of the staff was just standing around. We ordered 2 Cobra beers to start off the meal. Wow.. the beer was SO SMOOTH. The bottle had the words "impossibly smooth" written on it so I guess I shouldn't be surprised.. but I still was. It was the smoothest beer I've ever had and it might be one of my favorite brands of beer ever now. I ordered the chicken tikka masala with garlic naan and basmati rice, and my bf ordered a lamb dish (I forgot the name lol). The staff was nice enough to split up the rice onto two plates for us and also plated our food on top of the rice. The rice was amazing.. buttery and delicious. The sauce for my chicken tikka masala was bombbbbb and the chunks of chicken were cooked well. I only had one bite of my bfs lamb dish since I'm not a fan of lamb, but I remember it being good as well. I was very impressed with my meal, especially since we were not planning to come here. This is a very solid place to go near Paddington station if you are craving Indian food!

9aJrDhnqbjtbmtKpel0o3g.text: We heard London is a hot spot for Punjabi food! This restaurant was walking distance from our hotel near Paddington station and it did not disappoint. We like our food a bit on the spicy side so should have let our server know that but other than that we had a very enjoyable meal. Lots of vegetarian options!

bUuau38e9aXRM0fwsWCMxQ.text: Great food! We walked past and thought we'd give it a try being very hungry.  We were lucky - the food was awesome. I had the butter chicken and it was perfectly flavoured and the garlic nan smashing.  You can order extra vegetables but I did not. Maybe I should have?  It was hard to figure out what the waiter meant about it due to his poor English.  The place was packed, a good sign. It was not the nicest decor on the walls or very posh but the food was rather cheap - £50 for two meals and drinks.  Would go back!

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom. Lovely papadoum

dmHcp-csIIZEqyi_dd-TmA.text: Absolutely incredible Indian food! Could not fault it. Highly recommend the butter chicken and lamb pasanda. Only downside was it was a bit intimidating having so many waiters standing around with not much to do, but that may have been because we were dining earlier than the normal rush.

JGJGQHQN6-5EjLkedpbgnw.text: The hotel concierge steered us to Noor Johan II. It's was a 5 min walk from Paddington Station.  It was a nice clear day in London and we sat outside. Super friendly staff who recommended Lamb Jalfrazi very spicy for my companion and she loved it. I had the spicy chicken masala. The cauliflower was excellent as well. We both left happy and too full for dessert.

dC-P4xCWSOSseXYH-8wq2g.text: Really fantastic Indian food in London.  We spent this past week in London and ate there on a Monday evening and then returned on Friday as we couldn't get it out of our mind.  The ambiance is charming enough and the service is friendly but the key reason to eat here is the quality of their food.  The chicken tikka masala was just outstanding and the shrimp vindaloo was savory and spicy.  For a side we had the okra and the eggplant -- both of which are highly recommended.  The only knock on Noorjahan is that we found the portion sizes to be a bit smaller than what we typically get in NYC.  But quality over quantity is an easy trade off given the quality of this restaurant.  We also tried Punjab (yeah, we know, we eat a ton of Indian food) and found it to be quite average by comparison.  We highly recommend Noorjahan.

A5k9bqRVUY0vpl5sFcZWEQ.text: Truly excellent food in smaller portions. For 5 people we had Butter Chicken, Chicken Dansahk(with lentils and fenugreek), Lamb Biryani, Niramish(mixed veggies), Aloo Gobi, Channa Masala, Saffron Rice and Garlic Naan. Everything was delicious, one of the best Indian meals we've had in awhile. Service was efficient if not the friendliest. Would return.

PvajFXWqVBD8YfI3rfKmuw.text: Each time in London, this is on our list of restaurants. That and I stay a block away. Even if I didn't, I'd commute a reasonable distance for this Indian food. Order, go across the street to the pub, have a pint, pick up your food, devour said meal, repeat next time in town. Very British, very, very good.

9idzj0Rad81rpNPFq6_p5w.text: Chef's special lamb was wonderful and the service was exceptional.  Would go back.

RN3UURA2irBlhzOggl5Mxg.text: This place had potential but was just meh overall.  The spicy chicken tika masala could have been hotter both spice wise and temperature wise but had nice flavor.  We were the only table in the restaurant and instead of being attentive the staff all clustered in one spot talking VERY loudly while our water glasses sat empty more than once.The naan was good, the saffon rice nothing special and the chicken goa we wouldn't order again.

6rlAzi8kl7Uv2ugDHd9ZsQ.text: Decent Indian Food - not the best but certainly not the worst. The food was good, not quite spicy enough for me and I asked for it hot. The staff was great to us. We didn't have a reservation and had a group of 5 folks. One of the staff members immediately went into action and pulled a couple of tables together to accommodate us. Would def eat there again.

8HetYbRDdQM7DVZeIJC8Jw.text: This is exactly the sort of Indian restaurant I like when in London. Unpretentious, courteous, very reliable and solid Indian dishes. I try and pay them a visit every time I am in London, and I've never had a bad experience. Easy walk from Paddington, I even found myself booking a hotel in this area so that I could have dinner there. Beware, it is busy any day.

photos.caption: Photo of NoorJahan II - London, United Kingdom

ByPVHGYrQTJUa1UtPbWHoQ.text: I love Noorjahan so much because I used to order take out from here every time I was in London (every month).  Eating in is a wonderful experience because the setting is very nice and intimate, but take out is very convenient and the curries are delicious and thicker than they are in the States.  I never got used to having to pay for rice with your curry, but the nan is delicious so perhaps just get one or the other!

U9G7TEyZc_Lk3GHC7YiCFg.text: Great food every single time we go!!! Even when you order take out!!  YUmmy! We even ate here on Christmas eve!

JWPMDxh2V-yvDhczbSTZcw.text: Visited last night having seen some very positive reviews online (on other sites sshh!). Apparently this place is regarded as one of the best Indian restaurants in London so did it live up to its reputation..? Interior is contemporary and more upmarket that your typical curry house. Prices are also slightly higher, ranging from £7.50 to £14 for a main dish without rice/naan. 'Optional' 10% service charge is also added to the bill. One small quibble - like most Indian menus, it says that you can ask for a dish not listed on the menu and they'll always do their best to make it. There are only 4 vegetarian main dishes on the menu, so my partner asked for paneer jalfrezi. Surely not that weird? It was met with a stern 'no' and look of exasperation from the waiter. But he did agree on veg jalfrezi, thankfully. The food certainly doesn't disappoint - it's nicely prepared and possibly more subtly spiced than usual. There's not much room on the tables to the waiters serve everything onto your plate with great diligence to make sure you get all the nice sauce. The restaurant is clearly very busy and popular, and maximum tables have been squeezed into a fairly small area. This makes it feel a little cramped and hectic, but the food seems to arrive within minutes of ordering so ideal if you are grabbing a quick dinner before moving on somewhere else.

rZ9LqEKOYsCIbKgTtmKg1Q.text: based on the feedback from yelp and proximity to my hotel, I gave this a try.   I wanted to see what all the talk of great indian food in London was about.   I arrived at 1pm on a Monday (Bank Holiday) and I was the only person in the restaurant.   That threw me off a bit, but no big deal.  The service was kind and menu was filled with standard indian fare.I was quite surprised when I learned that most of the items did not include either rice or naan.  £10.5 for Chicken Tikki Masala and I have to order rice (£2.5/$4) and/or naan (£2.6/$4.25) separately.  ok, london is expensive.  Looking back, and one $24 lunch behind me, I felt that the CTM was pretty good.   The spices gave it a sweet flavor, not hot spicy at all, which is what I'm more accustomed to.   Was it great? no.  Pretty good?  yes.   If those were the same prices for the evening meal, I can see that it could be worth it.  I give it a solid 3 stars, maybe 3.5, but think it is in the 3 £ range instead of the published 2 £ rating.

-EITZlzCaVnT6_YGyX99sQ.text: So far, this is the best Indian I've had in London. My fiancé walked to pick up take away and the service was great. He got a drink on the house while he waited. The food itself was excellent, and definitely much better than any Indian I've ever had back in the States. We got garlic naan, samosas, chicken tikka masala, and chana masala. The garlic naan and chicken tikka masala are the best I've EVER had. We will definitely be back.

QlgAJHier7DtvsT5U6JSyA.text: I expected London to have the best Indian food outside of India. My meal was certainly not bad, but I've had just as good in California. Service was nothing spectacular

ajrHNWpDrc9lTLQtxPWBtQ.text: This place really got off on the wrong foot with me with indifferent and disrespectful initial service. Eventually, the service improved as the headcount increased and the general manager arrived.My first reaction was surprise at the simple, traditional menu, but that was just my ignorance. The food knocked my socks off. The nan was crispy and chewy at the same time, and the chicken starter was fantastic. Everything was perfectly spiced with the most wonderful flavors and after-burn. Each dish was fresh and distinct tasting. The pistachio kulfi was decent and well prepared, but compared to the preceding meal it was just 'ok'.I can't wait to go back here on my next trip to London.

YpqGnq4wZaASLM1qxt5f5w.text: Indian food is supposed to "good" in London, right?  Coming from Silicon Valley with a large Indian population, I was expecting some culinary competition.  Unfortunately our meal, despite reviews, did not live up to expectations.  We had ordered the butter chicken and the fish curry, but everything was disturbingly sweet.  The chicken was overcooked and chewy. The rest of the dishes - okra, rice and naan were fine, nothing extraordinary.  Lastly, the service left little to be desired.  The staff seemed flustered when they saw us walking in the door with our 3 year old son and ushered us to the downstairs part of the restaurant.  Despite the downstairs being completely unoccupied, our waiter still seemed annoyed that a child was present and was happily talking about seeing Big Ben that day.  10 minutes later, I saw our waiter grinning as he seated a British couple and I had to do a double take.  Sorry Noorjahan, but -1.5 point for the food and -1.5 for the service if you are dining with a child.

6XWT3_v1WMrDGVt1Yt-mKg.text: Yummy Indian within 2-3 minute walk of Lancaster London hotel. Definitely will go back, again.
